title: Map of Trade and Extent of Islam - pattern

content.question: Which of the following statements best describes a pattern evident on the map?

choices.label: Trans-Saharan commerce brought North African traders, scholars, and administrators to West Africa, introducing Islam to the region.
The Red Sea connected the Aksumite Empire to major maritime trade networks in the Mediterranean, linking it to the Roman Empire.
The coastal location of East Africa’s city-states linked Africa to Arab, Persian, Indian, and Chinese trading communities.
Portuguese and African trade increased the presence of Africans in Iberian port cities like Lisbon and Seville.

content.answer: The coastal location of East Africa’s city-states linked Africa to Arab, Persian, Indian, and Chinese trading communities.
